name: Russet Burbank
fun_fact: The Russet Burbank potato was originally bred to resist potato blight, a disease that caused the Irish Potato Famine.

recipes.name: Crispy Skin Russets
recipes.description: A dish that celebrates the thick skin of Russet potatoes, baked and rubbed with sea salt and olive oil to create a crunchy snack.

recipes.name: Rustic Russet Mash
recipes.description: A hearty mashed potato dish with skins left on, seasoned with cracked pepper and herbs for a farm-style taste.

name: Yukon Gold
fun_fact: Yukon Gold potatoes were developed in Canada and are named after the Yukon River and their golden flesh.

recipes.name: Golden Herb Medley
recipes.description: Sautéed Yukon Golds with rosemary, thyme, and garlic — perfect as a golden side to any entrée.

recipes.name: Yukon Potato Cakes
recipes.description: Pan-fried cakes made from mashed Yukon Golds mixed with green onions and cheese.

name: Red Pontiac
fun_fact: Red Pontiac potatoes are known for their vibrant red skin, which often fades when exposed to sunlight.

recipes.name: Pontiac Garden Hash
recipes.description: A veggie-packed hash using Red Pontiac potatoes and seasonal vegetables, ideal for brunch.

recipes.name: Red Skin Medallions
recipes.description: Thinly sliced and roasted Red Pontiacs topped with a balsamic glaze.

name: Purple Majesty
fun_fact: Purple potatoes get their color from anthocyanins, the same antioxidant found in blueberries.

recipes.name: Majestic Purple Wedges
recipes.description: Roasted wedges with a smoky paprika rub, served with lemon aioli.

recipes.name: Purple Potato Salad
recipes.description: A visually striking salad with tangy mustard dressing and fresh herbs.

name: Kennebec
fun_fact: Kennebec potatoes are a favorite among chip manufacturers due to their uniform shape and low sugar content.

recipes.name: Kennebec Chips
recipes.description: Crispy homemade chips seasoned with Himalayan salt and malt vinegar.

recipes.name: Twice-Baked Kennebecs
recipes.description: Potatoes baked, scooped, and refilled with a cheesy chive mash.

name: Fingerling
fun_fact: Fingerling potatoes naturally grow small and narrow — they aren't just baby potatoes.

recipes.name: Garlic Fingerlings
recipes.description: Roasted whole fingerlings in garlic butter and rosemary.

recipes.name: Mini Fingerling Skewers
recipes.description: Grilled on skewers with bell peppers and onions for a colorful side.

name: German Butterball
fun_fact: German Butterball potatoes are heirloom varieties with rich, buttery flesh — they store well in winter.

recipes.name: Butterball Stew
recipes.description: A winter stew with tender chunks of German Butterballs and root vegetables.

recipes.name: Roasted Butterball Discs
recipes.description: Thinly sliced and oven-roasted for crispy, buttery rounds.

name: Adirondack Blue
fun_fact: Adirondack Blue potatoes were bred by Cornell University and keep much of their color even when cooked.

recipes.name: Blue Mashed Delight
recipes.description: Vibrant blue mashed potatoes whipped with cream and nutmeg.

recipes.name: Adirondack Smash
recipes.description: Lightly smashed and roasted for a crunchy blue exterior.

name: La Ratte
fun_fact: La Ratte potatoes are a French gourmet variety once prized by Louis XIV.

recipes.name: French Herb Roasters
recipes.description: La Ratte roasted with herbes de Provence and a drizzle of lemon oil.

recipes.name: La Ratte Purée
recipes.description: Ultra-smooth French-style mash often paired with fine meats.

name: All Blue
fun_fact: Despite its name, the All Blue potato has both blue skin and blue flesh.

recipes.name: Blue Gratin
recipes.description: A creamy layered dish that lets the color of the All Blue potato shine through.

recipes.name: All Blue Croquettes
recipes.description: Deep-fried croquettes with a crunchy outside and blue mashed center.

name: Norland
fun_fact: Norland potatoes are early-harvest reds that are particularly cold-tolerant.

recipes.name: Norland Veggie Roast
recipes.description: Diced and roasted with carrots, parsnips, and herbs.

recipes.name: Red Breakfast Hash
recipes.description: Breakfast hash featuring Norland potatoes, peppers, and onions.

name: Caribe
fun_fact: Caribe potatoes have purple skin and white flesh, often grown in Canada and the northern U.S.

recipes.name: Caribe Grill Toss
recipes.description: Cubed and grilled with a lemon-pepper glaze.

recipes.name: Caribe Skillet Crust
recipes.description: Layered on the bottom of a cast-iron pan for a crispy potato base.

name: Maris Piper
fun_fact: Maris Piper is the most widely grown potato in the UK, known for its versatility.

recipes.name: British Bake-Away
recipes.description: Baked potatoes topped with baked beans and cheddar cheese.

recipes.name: Piper Puffs
recipes.description: Fluffy potato puffs, deep-fried for a light, crunchy snack.

name: Desiree
fun_fact: Desiree potatoes originated in the Netherlands and are known for their pink skin and yellow flesh.

recipes.name: Desiree Dippers
recipes.description: Wedges made for dipping, served with spicy mayo and garlic aioli.

recipes.name: Creamy Desiree Mash
recipes.description: Velvety mashed potatoes with roasted garlic and parsley.

name: Red Gold
fun_fact: Red Gold potatoes have a striking red skin with golden flesh, often used in premium seed mixes.

recipes.name: Red Gold Rounds
recipes.description: Pan-fried circles with a chili-lime seasoning.

recipes.name: Golden Glow Soup
recipes.description: Creamy soup using Red Golds as the base, blended with leeks and dill.

name: Bintje
fun_fact: Bintje potatoes were named after a schoolgirl in the Netherlands — and have been popular since 1910.

recipes.name: Dutch Farmer’s Pie
recipes.description: A layered dish with spiced ground meat, vegetables, and mashed Bintjes.

recipes.name: Crispy Bintje Coins
recipes.description: Thin slices roasted until crisp with sea salt and rosemary.

name: Rose Finn Apple
fun_fact: Despite its name, this potato is not related to apples — the name comes from its rosy skin and slightly sweet flavor.

recipes.name: Rose Roast Tangle
recipes.description: Whole roasted with olive oil and crushed black pepper.

recipes.name: Finn Apple Fritters
recipes.description: Savory fritters made from grated potato and onions, pan-fried to golden.

name: Ozette
fun_fact: Ozette is an ancient potato cultivated by the Makah tribe for centuries before commercial farming.

recipes.name: Tribal Earth Mash
recipes.description: A rustic mashed potato with smoky paprika and wild garlic.

recipes.name: Ozette Fire Bake
recipes.description: Whole roasted in foil over an open fire, eaten skin and all.

name: Carola
fun_fact: Carola potatoes are known for their creamy texture and originate from Germany, often favored by gardeners for their high yield.

recipes.name: Carola Cream Smash
recipes.description: A smooth mashed potato dish using the potatoes natural butteriness with a touch of sour cream.

recipes.name: Golden Carola Bake
recipes.description: Oven-baked with herbs and Gruyère cheese, forming a rich gratin crust.

name: French Marquette
fun_fact: The French Marquette is a lesser-known gourmet potato appreciated in French cuisine for its smooth texture and delicate skin.

recipes.name: Marquette Lyonnaise
recipes.description: Thin slices sautéed in butter and onions in a French country style.

recipes.name: Marquette Dijon Mix
recipes.description: Pan-roasted cubes tossed in Dijon mustard and fresh tarragon.

name: German Blue
fun_fact: German Blue potatoes have a striking blue-purple hue and contain natural antioxidants that help protect the tuber from pests.

recipes.name: Blue Rösti Stack
recipes.description: Crisped shredded German Blue potatoes layered with chives and sour cream.

recipes.name: Mystic Blue Soup
recipes.description: A blended soup with a purple-blue tint, flavored with leeks and vegetable stock.

name: German Butterball
fun_fact: This heirloom variety stores well through winter and gets even creamier with time.

recipes.name: Golden Butterball Wedges
recipes.description: Oven-roasted with smoked salt and rosemary sprigs.

recipes.name: Rustic Butterball Medley
recipes.description: A rustic skillet dish combining German Butterballs, mushrooms, and kale.

name: Purple Peruvian
fun_fact: Native to the Andes, Purple Peruvian potatoes are one of the oldest domesticated potatoes in the world.

recipes.name: Andean Purple Bites
recipes.description: Mini roasted bites with cumin and garlic, showcasing their earthy flavor.

recipes.name: Peruvian Potato Platter
recipes.description: Served cold with a lime and cilantro dressing for a South American-style salad.

name: Red Gold
fun_fact: Red Gold potatoes are popular among small farmers for their disease resistance and pretty two-tone flesh.

recipes.name: Gold Brick Fries
recipes.description: Thick steak-cut fries with a crispy red skin and golden interior.

recipes.name: Sunset Gold Mash
recipes.description: Mashed Red Golds blended with roasted garlic and a hint of turmeric.

name: Red La Soda
fun_fact: Red La Soda potatoes were developed in Florida and are well-known for their deep red skin and excellent heat tolerance.

recipes.name: La Soda Summer Salad
recipes.description: A refreshing salad made with boiled Red La Sodas, green onions, and a lemon-dill vinaigrette.

recipes.name: Crispy La Soda Smashers
recipes.description: Boiled then smashed and roasted Red La Sodas with sea salt and thyme, offering a crunchy outside and creamy center.
